definition: (of a couple) to be harmonious/to be each other's sunshine
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
feeling/emotion/passion/situation
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
pleased

sentences.english: I think the young love can sometimes be the most important.
sentences.chinese: 但是我想真爱的关键在于两情相悦。

sentences.english: The two lovers exchange solemn vows and pledges without any impurity.
sentences.chinese: 两情相悦海誓山盟没有任何杂质的感情。

sentences.english: Warm coffee pleases you and me.
Love is not the two lovers, will have a reduced wilderness.
sentences.chinese: 爱情没能两情相悦，必然会有一个人沦落荒野。

sentences.english: Be patient, wait for the right one.
sentences.chinese: 耐心一点，等待那个真正两情相悦的人吧。

sentences.english: The two lovers happy, always has the heroic sacrifice oneself.
sentences.chinese: 两情相悦的幸福，背后总有自我牺牲的悲壮。
